title: narrow
string formatting
code:
class evaluator:__format__=exec

f'''{evaluator():
def main():
  print("Hello, world!")

main()
exit()
}'''

title: cold jail
code:
# like any jail, you need to get the contents of flag.txt
import re

def curry(a):
    def X(b):
        def Y(c):
            # todo: fix typo
            return a(c(b))
        return Y
    return X


code = input()

# it's cold outside, all your functions need something warm to wear
assert re.match(r"^(\([a-z]+\))*$", code), "wrong format"
assert all(x not in code for x in ("eval", "exec", "breakpoint")), "no rce please"
assert len(code) < 105, "too long"

eval(code)

title: tutorial
code:
# simple python operator tutorial
# created by bulmenisaurus. part of the timed programming session. time spent coding: 437 seconds (~7 minutes).
#note: needs to be run in a standalone script

a=b=1
a=‍=b # -> true
a!=b # -> false

# integer division (repeating operator means integer result)
print(a // b) # -> 1

# ** means integer multiplication
a, b = 10, 5
print(a *‍* b) # -> 50

# same with modulo (python uses %)
print(a %‍% b) # -> 0

# like other c like lanaguages, python has -- and ++
print(+‍+a) # -> 11
a--‍
print(a) # -> 10

title: login
code:
import codecs
password = "lucky!"
while password:
    func = [codecs.decode, codecs.encode][input("which one [e/d] ") == "e"]
    password = func(password, input("how "), "strict")
    print(password)
print("Welcome to macOS")
print(open("flag.txt").read())
